PathToTownHall.Body: You're on a mission. You don't really need a reminder why because another glance up into the sky shows you that the giant continent crushing meteor has gotten even closer and will probably strike the earth in aproximately 30 minutes. Normally that would be curtains for everything, but you've been informed by your agency that a machine is bringing that thing to earth and that it also has the ability to push it back. You've localized the radiation it gives off to the center of this town in its townhall. You've got a lot of loved ones that you haven't said goodbye to... but if you can turn this machine around... you'll give everyone on the planet their lives back. As you push closer to the middle of this town through a sea of scared people, you steel your emotions, you'll need to think fast and logically if this is going to work.

runIntoMan.Body:
You run into an old man who reaches out to grab you, and takes firm hold of your shoulders. You want to shove him off, but before you do, you notice his expression. He isn't terrified like the others fleeing around you, his expression is much more sad and desperate than that.

"I didn't... I didn't know..." He gasps between breaths. His frail voice betrays the iron grip he's now got on you.

Choices.Text: "What do you mean you didn't know?"

humorHim.Body: "This w-wasn't supposed to happen". He looks at you with a pleading expression. "The money they gave me was going to save my whole family". He turns his head up to face the meteor still looming in the sky and getting closer by the moment. "I didn't know it'd be this".

Choices.Text: "Wait, do you have something to do with the machine?"

ignoreHim.Body: You shrug the old man off and push past him. His mouth hangs open as if he wants to say something, but he shuts it just as quick and turns away from you with a final worried expression to follow a throng of scared civilians. You can't waste time thinking about some random person right.

humorHim2.Body:
Your question snaps him out of his daze and his panic returns. He backs away into the crowd before you can stop him, shouting final words at you.

"The safe behind the receptionists desk has what you need! I'm sorry!" His voice fades away as he's absorbed back into the throng of escaping people.

Entrance.Body: Stumbling and shoving through groups of fleeing townsfolk, you eventually get to the front of the townhall. It's a small wooden building with an unimpressive paneled exterior, the chipped paint telling of the economic hardships this town has experienced as of late. But none of that matters right now. You can see a strange blue light emenating from a window on the second floor. If this doesn't work... well its not like running away would have worked in the first place.

MainLobby.Body: The ruckus outside is barely muted by the walls when standing in the lobby. You survey the room and notice a couple key points. There's a set of stairs that leads up to the second floor with an entrance covered by smaller set of double doors. The main room is in disarray with a couple chairs turned over and papers scattered all about. The receptionists desk sits just beneath the stairs. Off to the left side of the room, the door to what appears to be a cleaning closet sits ajar.

JanitorsCloset.Body: There's a couple brooms, a mop, and a mop bucket on the floor. The closet is fairly deep but darkness obscures anything past the first few feet.

Items.Descr: A crowbar hangs on a peg on the right wall. What would they need a crowbar for?
Items.Grabbed: You pick up the crowbar and swing it around a little bit before stowing it away. Half Life made this look way easier.

keyedBodies.Body: You turn on the flash light and reveal the back of the closet. A map of the town sits posted on the wall with a red line drawn from one of the houses to the middle where the town hall is. Next to the map is a sticky note with the number "49280" on it.

ReceptionDesk.Body: The receptionists desk is in a sorry state. The wood is cracked and unmaintained. Their was a computer that sat ontop of this desk but it has since been displaced to the ground behind the desk. Quite violently considering the way its lodged in the floor. A big stainless steel safe with a keypad sits hidden under the desk.

Choices.Text: Look closer at the safe's keypad

Items.Descr: You accidentally kick an object on the ground which roles up against the toppled roller chair. You look down and notice a Flash Light. Could be useful.
Items.Grabbed: You lift the ancient metal thing and flick it on and off. Not super powerful but it'll work for now.

SecondFloorDoor.Body: You walk up the stairway to stand face to face with a set of double doors. A brass lock holds the doors together and stops you from going further. You can see blue light from the crack in between the two doors. You can hear the rumble of the meteor approaching. Once you find a way through these doors, you can't go back.

keyedChoices.Text: Pry the lock off the door with the crowbar

DeskSafe.Body: You've seen models like this one before, but you've never been much of a safe cracker.

Success.Text: The safe makes an affirmative beep and the door unlocks with a click. You look inside.

Failure.Text: The safe buzzes angrily. The code wasn't correct.

InsideSafe.Body: There's a couple stacks of bills in the safe as well as a Ruger Mark IV. Makes sense if the receptionist had to defend themself, but not really useful in a pinch since they'd have to unlock the safe first.

Choices.Text: Close the safe and stand up

Items.Descr: You also see a manual sitting on a shelf in the back with a picture of the machine you were briefed on adorning the cover.
Items.Action: Pick up and flip through the manual
Items.Grabbed: This manual is long and really in depth. You're truly suprised by the in depth nature of this piece of technical literature. Despite the sheer quantity of information though, you're able to surmise that to reverse the machine, you need to flip the red and green switches at the same time, then push the blue and white buttons at the same time, and finally flip the big red lever on the side of it.

MachineRoom.Body: The lock snaps with a loud crack and falls to the floor. You shove the doors open to reveal the machine you were briefed on glowing with a ghostly blue light as well as emmiting a soft whir. You imagined a world ending catastrophe device would be louder. Among the various input mechanisms dotting its surface, two large pieces stand out to you. A large red and orange lever on oposite sides of the machine. The rumble of the meteor is louder than ever. If you're going to figure this out, you have to do it now.

Choices.Text: Start fiddling with the smaller mechanisms

PhaseOne.Body: After analyzing the exterior, you know you should start with the set of 6 switches at the bottom based on the briefing. You'll need to flip two at once

Success.Text: You can here mechanisms going off inside the machine.

Failure.Text: The blue light grows stronger and all inputs mechanisms become locked in place.

PhaseTwo.Body: You're spurred on by success, the next step should be the 4 buttons sitting a few feet about the switches. You'll have to press both of these at the same time as well.

Success.Text: The machine rocks violently and the light becomes purple

Failure.Text: The blue light becomes blindingly bright suddenly and all inputs mechanisms become locked in place.

PhaseThree.Body: This is the last step. Sweat beads on your forehead. You need to pull one of the two big levers. If you pick the right one, you've saved the day. If you pick the wrong one, then this was all for nothing.

Death.Body:
You fiddled with the machine as best you could but the light never changed again. The rumbling of the meteor eventually turns into the loudest roar you'd ever heard. You got more and more frantic as panic finally started to take over... but then you stopped. The roar had become so deafening that it felt like silence now. You wish things could have been different as you sit on that cold, lonely floor and wait for the end.

You Die, just like everyone else.

tryToQuit.Body: Well I don't really have the ability to do that so you'll have to click the x button yourself if you want to do that. It's a lot easier to just click the Try Again button

Win.Body: The roaring of the meteor almost instantly stops as the light turns bright red. You almost don't believe it. You sprint to the door and stumble down the stairs. You burst through the double doors and look up to see whats going on. As if by magic, the meteor has been stopped and is floating above the earth. Residents who had gone outside to greet their death with dignity wore shocked faces all around. Slowly, the meteor starts to shrink from taking up the entire sky, to occupying a hemisphere, to floating away out into space. You saved the day! You fall to your knees as you sigh in relief. You need a vacation after this one.
